summary: Adds the tunic and shoes of the Nilfaardian emissary, Shilard Fitz-Oesterlen from the Witcher 2.
descriptionHtml:
=========================================================================================
Description:
=========================================================================================
This plugin will add the tunic and shoes of the Nilfaardian emissary, Shilard Fitz-Oesterlen from the Witcher 2 to Skyrim. A very elaborate garb that fits the look of a noble, vampire or Thalmor diplomat, this outfit will add a touch of medieval (high) class to any character.

The unarmoured tunic, shoes and amulet can be purchased at Radiant Raiment in Solitude. The tunic with plated leggings and gauntlet, as well as an alternative amulet can be taken from a chest at the foot of the bed upstairs in the Thalmor Justiciars Headquarters in Solitude. Alternatively:

- Open the console using the ` key
- Type \' Help Emissarys\'
- Type \'player.additem xxxxxxx\' entering the code for each desired item

To install, simply extract the contents of the .rar file into the Skyrim\\Data folder.



=========================================================================================
Version History
=========================================================================================
Version 1.00 - Shilard Fitz-Oesterlen\'s garb added to Skyrim.



=========================================================================================
Additional info:
=========================================================================================
My second port of Witcher 2 models and texture resources supplied by the Witcher5688. The content of this mod is yours to do with as you wish within Skyrim or other plugins (including replacers or leveled lists for NPCs), provided I\'m credited with getting the models functioning in Skyrim.

 
Special thanks to:

Witcher5688, who ported these meshes and textures.
CDProject Red, the owners and creators of these meshes and textures who have kindly given their permission for their use.
author: Antioch08
